data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You do not always face forward. The opposite direction of your path will always be backwards. Not all steps in the instructions are backward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn right is the same as turn around. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

There are 60 steps in one direction and 120 steps in the other. To go back 2 degrees you take 4 steps back, or one complete turn. A complete turn is where you go back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 1 step to return to the starting point from 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning around is to return to the beginning. Turning around is to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The instructions say you take 6 steps and turn around. The sequence of taking 6 steps and 8 steps is repeated until you return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you'll always take the first step in whatever direction you're facing. If you take one step left, you'll always take the next step in whatever direction you're facing. If you take four steps forward, you'll always take the next step in whatever direction you're facing. So, the answer is Yes.

A person who turns around takes the final step and must return to the starting point. If you take 9 steps and take 2 steps, you must turn around and take 8 steps. Final answer: No.

If you continue to face forward, you will eventually return to the starting point. Walking backward will always get you back. So, the answer is yes.

To go backward, there are always 2 steps out from the starting point. The starting point is front right corner of the circle. Thus, the answer is No.

Steps right to all directions is a straight line a left to all directions left is a straight line. Across is a 3 12 sided triangle and all angles are not equal. Right to all directions is 3 right 3 = 6 steps so 4 steps take backwards and left, take backwards, take backwards and take right 3 = 4 steps take right. So, the answer is No.

One can return to the starting point in one of the following ways: Take 6 steps right. The starting point is facing right. If one moves left, one moves to the next right and so on. Left is the opposite of right and does not return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
